1.text: Paul, a prisoner of Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon, our beloved fellow worker,

2.text: to the beloved Apphia, to Archippus our fellow soldier, and to the Church [that meets] in your house:

3.text: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.text: I thank my God always, making mention of you in my prayers,

5.text: hearing of the love and faith which you have for the Lord Jesus and for all the saints.

6.text: I pray that your communion with us in the faith may become effective through the accurate knowledge of every good thing which is in us in Christ Jesus.

7.text: Indeed, we have much thankfulness and comfort in your love, because the hearts of the saints have been refreshed through you, brother.

8.text: Therefore, even though I am bold enough in Christ to command you [to do] what is appropriate,

9.text: yet for the sake of love, I would rather entreatâ€”I, Paul, now elderly and a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

10.text: I beg you for my child Onesimus, whose father I have become in my imprisonment.

11.text: He was once useless to you, but now he is useful to both you and to me.

12.text: I am sending him back; therefore, receive him as my own heart!

13.text: I desired to keep him with me so that on your behalf he might serve me in my chains for the Good News.

14.text: But I did not want to do anything without your consent: your goodness should not be forced, but of free will.

15.text: Maybe it happened that he was separated from you for a while, so that you might have him forever,

16.text: no longer as a slave, but more than a slave, as a beloved brother, especially to me and how much more to you, both in the flesh and in the Lord.

17.text: If then you consider me in communion with you, receive him as you would receive me.

18.text: However, if he has wronged you in any way or owes you anything, put that on my account.

19.text: I, Paul, write this with my own hand: I will pay it back (not to mention that you owe me even your own self).

20.text: Yes, brother, let me have joy from you in the Lord! Refresh my heart in the Lord!

21.text: Having confidence in your obedience, I write [this letter] to you, knowing that you will do even beyond what I say.

22.text: Also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.

23.text: Epaphras, my fellow prisoner in Christ Jesus, greets you,

24.text: as do Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.

25.text: May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit! Amen.
